feedData.title: ASOPR and Binary CDD Indicate Potential Market Bottom for Bitcoin
feedData.subTitle:
The post aSOPR and Binary CDD Indicate Potential Market Bottom for Bitcoin appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News

Current on-chain metrics suggest a possible market bottom for Bitcoin. The Adjusted Spent Output Profit Ratio (aSOPR) is at 0.99831902, down 0.96% in the last 24 hours, indicating that more investors are selling at a loss. Typically, this behavior is observed during bear market lows.

However, the Binary Coin Days Destroyed (CDD) is at 0.14285714, showing minimal movement from long-term holders over the past week. This indicates a strong incentive for long-term investors to retain their coins, hinting at underlying confidence in a future market recovery.

feedData.title: MicroStrategy’s Plan to Dump $500M Stock for BTC Suggests a Bullish Future for Crypto
feedData.subTitle:
Microstrategy is one of the earliest traditional institutes to back cryptocurrency, and they haven’t stopped just yet. In the most recent development, multiple reports have it that MicroStrategy plans a $500 million stock sale to fund additional Bitcoin acquisitions. This reinforces Microstrategy’s commitment to BTC as a treasury reserve asset, it further highlights the level of trust they have in the crypto sector. Meanwhile, savvy investors are spreading their tentacles, with many buying into new and innovative projects like Jasmycoin (JASMY) and Angry Pepe Fork (APORK).

MicroStrategy’s Plan to Sell $500M Stock for Bitcoin; Incoming Price Surge?

If the rumors turn out to be true, MicroStrategy’s $500M injection in Bitcoin (BTC)’s market cap could trigger a price rally for the legacy cryptocurrency. However, beyond price rally, MicroStrategy’s continuous investment in Bitcoin is indicative of the growing trust in the crypto sector by institutional investors.

While this growing interest in top crypto coins like BTC tokens is bound to create a ripple effect across the crypto market, it portrays a bright future for other innovative crypto projects that are going above and beyond to make an impact in the rapidly growing industry.

Angry Pepe Fork (APORK) Attracts Enormous  Attention with Innovative Incentivization Model

As the crypto sector continues to gain attention from institutional investors, emerging crypto projects especially in the meme coin market are beginning to focus on sustainable use cases rather than mere market sensation. Notably, Angry Pepe Fork (APORK) stands out for its innovative “conquer-to-earn” incentivization system. Essentially, this meme coin adopts a unique reward system that collectively rewards community members as they collaborate to push the coin up the ranks in the meme coin market. 

In other words, Angry Pepe Fork rewards participants as a collective and not individually as with most of its peers. This unique approach set the native APORK token apart in the market and has equally drawn the attention of many investors. Despite launching recently and in its initial presale stage, experts already have good insights about its trajectory, particularly due to its DeFi market features and earning mechanism. 

Additionally, Angry Pepe Fork’s introduces a staking dApp that provides passive income opportunity for community members. This particular staking mechanism offers flexible lock-in duration with high return on investments. Hence, $APORK holders can stake their holdings for either 30, 60 or 90 days and earn significant rewards.

Meanwhile, Angry Pepe Fork is currently in the initial presale stage where the native APORK token is selling at a modest price of $0.014. However, given its peculiarity and pioneering role, analysts have predicted a 200% rise for the token when the presale concludes and over 350% rise when it lists on top-tier CEX and DEX platforms.Moreso, considering the growing interest and frenzy in Solana-based meme coin, Angry Pepe Fork could conveniently see a 1000% rise this year and eventually rank among the best crypto coins to buy.

Jasmycoin Price’s Recent Ascent Sheds Light on Ecosystem Growth Potential

Billed as Japan’s Bitcoin, Jasmy (JASMY) is a tokenized platform that champions the democratization of data by combining blockchain and IoT technology to provide infrastructure for the safe usage of data. Although the native Jasmycoin (JASMY) is currently priced around $0.032 which is only a fraction of Bitcoin’s worth per token, the network has grown in popularity for its growth potential.

While high calibre executives like Kazumasa Sato, and Tadashi Morita, both of which are former top-ranking executives at Sony Corporations are part of the founding team, several crypto enthusiasts are willing to bet on the project as they believe it is capable of achieving great success. 

Moreso, with a growing community and a niched focus on IoT, JASMY network is poised to witness more growth in the coming years, ranking JASMY token among the best crypto coins to buy for substantial return.

Can Angry Pepe Fork Rival Jasmy Network In Utility?

Although they operate in different sectors, Angry Pepe Fork has the potential to rank alongside Jasmy in the battle for supremacy. Beyond the hype, Angry pepe Fork introduces a utility-backed token that rewards the collective efforts of participants within its ecosystem. This unique approach not only sets it aside among its peers, but also positions the token among the best meme coins to buy now. 

Visit Angry Pepe Fork Presale

feedData.content:
Miners sold $550 million worth of BTC in 2024
$BTC 
{spot}(BTCUSDT)

Crypto Quant founder Ki Yong - Ju said that early Bitcoin miners have made a profit of about $550 million this year. They sold their BTC digital coins in the price range of $62,000 to $70,000. The specialist also published a corresponding graph on his social media page X

Crypto Quant's latest data points to an interesting trend among early Bitcoin miners. As shown in the graph, a significant increase in sales was observed mainly during Bitcoin price spikes. This scenario is in line with historical patterns where miners capitalize on high market quotes by liquidating some of their assets.

Bitcoin miners have seen a significant increase in revenue in recent months, driven by the BTC exchange rate jumping to a new all-time high of $73,000 in March 2024. Despite the slight correction, the value of the asset remains significantly higher year-on-year.

Additionally, bitcoin's hash rate has reached unprecedented levels, peaking at 676 exa hashes per second (EH/s) in February 2024. The growth meant that more and more miners were involved in securing the network ahead of the halving procedure. This scenario also demonstrated high competition in the mining sector.

A critical factor affecting the activities of miners of the flagship digital coin was the event of halving the mining rewards. As a result of the halving, this dropped from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC per block, resulting in higher prices. It also increased operational challenges due to decreased profits.

In preparation for the halving, and after the procedure, many miners started selling off their BTC reserves to keep the business going. This strategic bitcoin sell-off caused the wallet balances of companies mining the major cryptocurrency to hit a three-year low of 1.8 million BTC.

In addition, the halving event prompted miners to upgrade their equipment. Over the past month, significant investments were made in new installations. It is reported that large companies have spent billions of United States dollars (USD).
#BTCFOMCWatch #BTC #bitcoin

Miner revenues have dropped by 55%, forcing them to sell more Bitcoin driving prices down.
Reduced issuance of stablecoins like USDT and USDC decreases market liquidity and increases price volatility.
Significant withdrawals from major ETFs are adding to the selling pressure on Bitcoin, impacting market stability.
Amid fluctuating sentiments in the crypto market, the overall market capitalization has declined 2.29%, settling at $2.33 trillion.
Miner Capitulation Impacts Market
Miners are facing significant revenue drops, leading to increased Bitcoin sales. Miner revenues have plummeted by 55%, forcing them to sell more Bitcoin to cover operational costs. Consequently, there has been a notable rise in Bitcoin transfers from miners’ wallets to exchanges, indicating that selling activity is driving prices down.

$ETH 
$SOL

Educational Post📕

Japanese Candlesticks - learning to read and understand

Japanese candlesticks are the most popular way to read the price movement on charts. They are visual, easy to learn and the main thing is that they work.

The first mention of candle patterns can be found in the Japanese rice trader Homma Munehisa in the 1700s. Almost 300 years later, candles were rediscovered by Steve Neeson in his book titled "Japanese Candles. Graphical analysis of financial markets".

Candlestick charts provide much more information compared to linear charts and are currently the preferred market analysis tool for traders and investors.

A bullish candle is formed when the price rises. In financial markets, the term bullish means a long position or a buy.

A bearish candle is formed when the price falls. In financial markets, the term bearish refers to a short position or sale.

feedData.title: Bitcoin Price Targets: No Confirmation of Bearish Bias, Bulls to Soon Revisit $67,000 Levels
feedData.subTitle:
The post Bitcoin Price Targets: No Confirmation of Bearish Bias, Bulls To Soon Revisit $67,000 levels appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News

Bitcoin price has been keeping the investors on edge with no clear confirmation of the bull or bear market. As expected, the price action over the weekend was relatively tame, with low volatility and a slight bullish relief. There has been a lingering question about how we could be in a bull market if the price has been consolidating sideways for months, which isn’t typically seen as bullish.

Analyst Josh of Crypto World gave a detailed analysis of the price trend and said that the chart hasn’t changed much over the last few days despite the short-term pullback. Currently, the Bollinger Bands indicator is still massively squeezing together, indicating contraction on the 4-day time frame. 

This suggests that the Bollinger Bands width indicator is at very low levels, the lowest seen in a long time. Historically, this usually precedes a massive volatile move in Bitcoin’s price, likely occurring soon. These volatile moves are typically 20-30% or even larger.

What’s the current scenario?

For now, as long as the price holds above the previous lows, which are around $60,000 based on candle closes (with the actual wick low at about $56,000), Bitcoin can technically remain in a larger bull market trend. However, this can happen during a larger bullish trend. 

If Bitcoin retraces lower in the short term, it needs to hold above at least $56,000. If it breaks below that level, we might start talking about the end of the bull market. But as of now, this hasn’t been confirmed. We could be within another massive sideways consolidation, which doesn’t necessarily signal the end of the bull market.

What’s next? 

Recently, Bitcoin retested a previous area of support, now acting as resistance around $67,000 to $68,000. A break below this level confirmed it as new resistance, aligning with the volume profile indicator, which shows a massive cluster of traded volume around $67,000 to $68,000. The next major cluster of volume support is around $63,000 to $64,000. 

The Bitcoin liquidation heat map shows significant liquidity around $64,600 to $65,000, with new liquidity building to the upside around $67,300 to $67,400. This indicates that the price might revisit this resistance area before potentially seeing another rejection, considering the substantial resistance there.

Hashdex Proposes Hybrid Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF for Diverse Crypto Exposure:
(𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗣𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗲 𝗨𝗦𝗗𝗧, 𝗜'𝗺 𝗶𝗻 𝗧𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗠𝘆 𝗨𝗦𝗗𝗧 𝗧𝗥𝗖20 𝗪𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗲𝘁 𝗔𝗱𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀.  TKicbLUYswCSSbE147NQLEKAPn1oU6JCCB)

Hashdex, a Brazilian crypto asset manager, has proposed a hybrid Bitcoin and Ethereum ETF, offering investors diversified exposure to the top cryptocurrencies. This innovative ETF aims to enhance investment opportunities in the dynamic crypto market.

Hashdex to Launch Hybrid ETF Combining Bitcoin and Ethereum for Enhanced Crypto Investment
According to U.Today, Hashdex, a Brazilian cryptocurrency asset manager, is poised to introduce a hybrid spot exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the value of Ethereum and Bitcoin. This innovative investment opportunity holds the potential for significant returns, making it an intriguing prospect for those keen on the cryptocurrency market.

As detailed in the filing, the ETF's structure is a testament to Hashdex's unwavering commitment to providing a secure and transparent avenue for gaining investment exposure to Bitcoin and Ether through the public securities market. This commitment fosters a strong sense of security and confidence in potential investors, assuring them of the reliability of this investment opportunity.

Hashdex intends to concurrently utilize at least two custodians for the ETF: Coinbase and BitGo. The Hashdex Nasdaq Crypto Index US ETF will be capitalization-weighted, meaning that the weight of each asset in the portfolio is determined by its market capitalization. This structure ensures that the ETF's performance is closely aligned with the overall performance of the cryptocurrency market, with Bitcoin (BTC) comprising 70.54% of the portfolio. The weightings will be adjusted quarterly to account for fluctuations in market value.

London, London, June 18th, 2024, Chainwire

Solciety, a new entrant in the crypto's PolitiFi sector, officially launches today, 18th June at 14:00 UTC, initiating a 30-day presale of its Solciety (SLCTY) tokens.
3 billion Solciety (SLCTY) tokens will go on sale, starting at $0.0015, with price increases on the smart contract every 72 hours across ten stages. The final presale price will be $0.0040, giving day one buyers a potential 169% increase on the value of their bags before the project becomes available for public trading.
Described as "the political party for degens," Solciety plans on using the viral potential of memes and political satire to potentially explode alongside the political powder keg that is the 2024 election season.
Community numbers have already passed 10,000 across socials before the live presale has even started - an indication that Solciety's offering of humor and degen politics is resonating with crypto communities around the world.
Straddling the Solana meme coin and PolitiFi sectors, worth a combined $10 billion, Solciety is strategically placed across two of crypto's most powerful narratives. And with Solana displacing Ethereum as the #1 maker of blue-chip meme coins thanks to its drastically lower fees, Solciety has multiple tailwinds behind it.

Never trade your soul. Never be egotistic! 
If you earn some today, maybe you catch a move from $64k up to $66k $BTC  or in alts as I said. 
Divide it to savings and current acc. 
For May my husband earned $95k from $45 and he lost it all again 😭
He hasn’t even bought me new shorts for the summer. I thought we earn money to buy a car and for vacation. 
But no, the margin call is worth everything. Somebody says I’m a girl and also egoistic, and I want he spends money on me and for us. 
But I can’t believe that it’s better to waste it all here? I would prefer to give someone like kids or suffering people, than choose a high leverage 🤯

I feel myself a little bit better than yesterday, maybe to express my feelings here is healing me. #Binance #bitcoin #bnb #margincall #divorce

translatedData.content:
Memecoin represents the “Wild West” image of DeFi. Thanks to the runaway success of tokens like Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB), the memecoin market boasts a market capitalization of $54.4 billion – a figure that seems outrageous given the assets This appears for the first time. Yet here we are.

As recently as March, memecoin trading volumes reached levels last seen just before the last cryptocurrency bubble burst in 2022. This resurgence highlights a familiar trend: the Traders easily get caught up in the hype and FOMO, to the point where they make impulsive investment decisions based on pure instinct and greed. In the Digital Asset Valuation Framework , the team at HashKey Capital and I made the case for applying fundamental valuation frameworks and high-level technical analysis to navigate the market's inherent volatility and avoid the pitfalls of memecoin mania.

Without getting too carried away with opinion, now more than ever we must deploy powerful frameworks and exercise cold judgment to realize true value in this most chaotic of markets. This is doubly true for institutional investors looking to gain a sustainable advantage and accumulate long-term value for digital assets.

feedData.content:
Memecoin thể hiện hình ảnh “Miền Tây hoang dã” của DeFi. Nhờ sự thành công vượt bậc của các token như Dogecoin (DOGE) và Shiba Inu (SHIB), thị trường memecoin tự hào có mức vốn hóa thị trường là 54,4 tỷ USD – một con số có vẻ quá đáng khi những tài sản này lần đầu tiên xuất hiện. Tuy nhiên, ở đây chúng tôi đang có.

Gần đây nhất là vào tháng 3, khối lượng giao dịch memecoin đã đạt đến mức được thấy lần cuối ngay trước vụ nổ bong bóng tiền điện tử cuối cùng vào năm 2022. Sự trỗi dậy này làm nổi bật một xu hướng quen thuộc: các nhà giao dịch dễ dàng bị cuốn vào sự cường điệu và FOMO, đến mức họ đưa ra các quyết định đầu tư bốc đồng dựa trên dựa trên bản năng thuần túy và lòng tham. Trong Khung định giá tài sản kỹ thuật số , nhóm tại HashKey Capital và tôi đã đặt ra trường hợp áp dụng các khung định giá cơ bản và phân tích kỹ thuật cấp cao để điều hướng sự biến động vốn có của thị trường và tránh những cạm bẫy của cơn cuồng memecoin.

Không đặt nặng quan điểm, giờ đây hơn bao giờ hết, chúng ta phải triển khai các khuôn khổ mạnh mẽ và đưa ra phán đoán lạnh lùng để nhận ra giá trị đích thực trong thị trường hỗn loạn nhất này. Điều này hoàn toàn đúng đối với các nhà đầu tư tổ chức đang tìm cách đạt được lợi thế bền vững và tích lũy giá trị lâu dài cho tài sản kỹ thuật số.

feedData.title: Bitcoin Month-Long Rally Comes To An End: Price Plunges Below $65,000 – What’s Next For BTC?
feedData.subTitle:
Bitcoin (BTC), the largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, experienced a significant decline on Tuesday, echoing the broader downtrend in the cryptocurrency market. Fueled by worries about the global economy and reduced summer liquidity, Bitcoin dropped below the $65,000 mark for the first time since May 16. 

Notably, Ethereum (ETH) also faced a 4% loss, trading at $3,400, while other cryptocurrencies, such as XRP, Solana (SOL), and dogecoin (DOGE), suffered even bigger declines.

Market Uncertainty Persists

Marko Jurina, CEO of Jumper.Exchange, a decentralized exchange (DEX), highlighted that during economic and market uncertainty, traders often sell at a discount to minimize losses or exit riskier positions until the situation becomes clearer. 

Related Reading

Jurina explained that the current scenario appears to be a combination of these factors, as weakening global economic conditions, unresolved geopolitical issues, and thinner market activity during the summer months contribute to heightened market volatility. 

These conditions will persist for the next few months, potentially leading to parabolic movements in either direction for the Bitcoin price.

Bitcoin has grappled with the $70,000 threshold since its record high of $73,700 on March 14. Although it briefly tested this level in early June, it has since been unable to regain its bullish momentum. The cryptocurrency is currently down 4% for the month and 9% for the quarter. 

Bitcoin Correction Toward $61,000?

CryptoQuant’s on-chain data suggests that traders had reduced their holdings since late May when Bitcoin touched the $70,000 level. This selling trend continues without significant buying activity.

Ki Young Ju, Founder of CryptoQuant, highlighted that Bitcoin long-term holder whales have sold $1.2 billion in the past two weeks, likely through brokers. Additionally, there have been negative net flows in ETFs, with $460 million outflows during the same period. 

Young Ju contended that if this substantial sell-side liquidity is not purchased over-the-counter (OTC), brokers may deposit Bitcoin to exchanges, potentially impacting the market.

On June 14, crypto analyst Ali Martinez stressed that Bitcoin needed to break above the $66,250 level quickly to avoid a potential correction to $61,100. As the cryptocurrency struggles to regain bullish momentum, Martinez hinted at a possible drop to $61,000. 

Another analyst, Rekt Capital, pointed out that Bitcoin is nearing the filling of its first Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) gap, with gaps at $64,000 and $62,500. 

Related Reading

Overall, The prevailing evidence suggests that bearish sentiment has once again seized control over the future trajectory of Bitcoin’s price, signaling a challenging road ahead for the leading cryptocurrency in the market. The extent of the potential retracement and the bottoming-out point of this ongoing downtrend are yet to be determined. 

The 1-D chart shows that BTC’s price is trending downward. Source: BTCUSD on TradingView.com

At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $64,770. 

Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com

Source: NewsBTC.com

The post Bitcoin Month-Long Rally Comes To An End: Price Plunges Below $65,000 – What’s Next For BTC? appeared first on Crypto Breaking News.

💵 Tether Unveils New Synthetic Dollar Backed by Gold 💲

Hey Binance community, big news just dropped! Tether, the heavyweight champion of stablecoins, is shaking things up with its latest innovation – a synthetic dollar that's backed by gold. Yep, you heard it right! This digital currency is pegged to the value of one US dollar and is supported by real, physical gold stored securely in Switzerland. 🪙

This move is a game-changer, especially with the Federal Reserve stumbling. The synthetic dollar aims to offer stability and trust, backed by the timeless value of gold. It's a solid choice for those looking to hedge against inflation and market volatility. 
Stay ahead of the curve and consider diversifying with Tether's new offering. This could be a smart move in the ever-evolving crypto landscape.

feedData.title: Dogecoin Long Liquidations Surge Past $60 Million Amid Market Dip
feedData.subTitle:
Dogecoin Long Liquidations Surge Past $60 Million Amid Market Dip

Dogecoin (DOGE) has seen a significant spike in long liquidations, surpassing $60 million in the past 24 hours as its price fell below the $0.12 mark. Remarkably, Dogecoin's liquidations were on par with those of Bitcoin, which also experienced just over $60 million in liquidations during the same timeframe. Given Bitcoin's much larger trading volume and market capitalization, this marked the most substantial daily liquidation event for Dogecoin since May 2021.

Dogecoin's trading metrics reveal a bearish sentiment among traders. Open interest in Dogecoin futures, representing the number of unsettled futures contracts, has dropped by over 18% to $642 million. Additionally, the long-short ratio for Dogecoin futures is now above 0.9, suggesting that traders are increasingly betting on further price declines. DOGE is down 8.6% in the past week, but has recovered slightly over the past 24 hours and traded up by 3.8%.

Large-cap memecoins in general have been trending downward. Shiba Inu (SHIB) and Pepe (PEPE) both dropped 8.8% over the past week, while leading Solana-based memecoin Dogwifhat (WIF) fell over 16.2%, according to CoinMarketCap data. The broader downtrend in memecoins and altcoins comes on the back of a decline in Bitcoin (BTC) price, which is down 2.88% in the past week.

The broader cryptocurrency market saw over $444 million in liquidations during the same period. According to Coinglass, the bulk of these liquidations, approximately $382 million, were long positions, indicating a widespread market downturn.

A humble request to Binance:

1. Please stop encouraging users to write and post anything. Many traders receive incorrect signals, and some who lack basic knowledge end up causing others to lose money.
2. Posting historical biographies offers little help. Many articles do not provide valuable learning for new traders.
3. Add credibility indicators for writers so users know who to trust for financial advice.
4. Separate the public interface/publications into a different pane, pop-up, or window to prevent basic or pro versions from becoming unresponsive.

Comments, complaints, and suggestions with reasonable arguments are always welcome.#altcoins #BTC #bitcoin #BTCFOMCWatch #BinanceTournament
